tool.name: RAxML

param.name: Out
param.label: Outgroup (optional)
param.help: The name of one or more (comma-separated) outgroup(s) can be specified

param.name: GAMMA
param.label: Gamma model of rate heterogeneity
param.help: If not checked, CAT model will be used.

param.name: PROT
param.label: Protein Sequences
param.help: If not checked, DNA sequences will be assumed

param.name: morphmodel
param.label: Multi-state morphological char model
param.help: Ignored unless specifying MULTI in model partition

param.name: Boot
param.label: Specify Number of bootstrap replicates
param.help: 100 tends to be sufficient, do not exceed 1000

param.name: part_file
param.label: Partition file
param.help: You may provide an alignment partition file.

param.name: constraint
param.label: BINARY Constraint Tree
param.help: This option allows you to specify an incomplete or comprehensive multifurcating constraint tree in NEWICK format.

param.name: ML
param.label: Maximum Likelihood Search
param.help: Will search for best scoring tree after the bootstraps.

tool.help:
**What it does**
RAxML estimates phylogenetic trees using Maximum Likelihood.
------
**Inputs**
Input file is a RAxML compatible text file. This can be generated by Osiris tools from an aligned fasta file with fasta2phylipE or from a PHYTAB format file with phylocatenator.
------
**Outputs**
RAxML writes the resulting tree file in newick text format, which can be viewed in Osiris with TreeVector (of the mothur package). In addition, if bootstrapping was selected, the individual bootstrap trees and the ML tree with support are written as separate newick files.
-------
**Additional Information**
raxml Home Page. http://www.exelixis-lab.org/software.html
-------
